javanews.events.gui
Class CloseComPortClient

java.lang.Object
  javanews.events.gui.CloseComPortClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.InternalFrameListener
public class CloseComPortClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.InternalFrameListener

This class handles any request to close a COM Port Client window. It does this by closing all log files gracefully and performs garbage collection prior to closing the window.

This class extends the WindowAdapter class and implements the ActionListener interface in order to handle both types of events generate either by the user closing the window, or requesting the exit through the file menu.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)

Constructor Detail

CloseComPortClient

public CloseComPortClient(COMPortClient cpcWindow)
Initialises the class and internal logger. It requires the instance of COMPortClient to be passed as an argument to ensure that the associated thread is closed before the window is shut and garbage collection is performed.

Parameters:
cpcWindow -

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
This method is called when the user clicks on File > Exit from the menu bar. It calls a central private method to perform the action so as to centralise the code.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
Parameters:
ae - The generated ActionEvent

closeWindow

private void closeWindow()
This method is called by both the actionPerformed() and windowClosing() methods. The actual functions are stored in this method to further centralise the code being executed. Any changes to the execution of the program during shutdown should be made here.

The method stops the executing thread in the parent instance of COMPortClient and performs garbage collection before the window is closed.
